item.title: Issues with drain and stagnant water, 11th February
item.description:
Issue has been like this for 8+ months. Iâ€™ve retired to contact Barnet council about this issue as it is a potential biohazard, however, I have not had any response. Location: behind Mala in the alleyway (back set of black steps). There is also lots of rubbish near these stairs (lighters, cans and drugs) possibly being used as a drug den. Feels very unkempt and dodgy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1353, High Road, Whetstone, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Rubbish accumulation never cleaned, 11th February
item.description:
This alley between 1 and 1a Bardsley Lane is used as a rubbish bin and never cleared out. It has gotten worse since the Council removed the rubbish bins next to the nearby benches (no idea why they are gone!) a street cleaner with a long litter picker is needed in order to deal with this. We see cleaners on Creek Road every day but Bardsley Lane is generally neglected.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 304, Creek Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
